channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Unesco: Wales' slate landscape bids for place on World Heritage list
item.description: Welsh slate landscape bids to join Egypt's Pyramids and India's Taj Mahal on prestigious list.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: How Matt Richards went from garden pool to gold
item.description: Matt Richards' relay swim team almost broke the world record as they won gold in Tokyo.

item.title: Bute Park attack: Girl, 16, charged with attempted murder
item.description: She is the third person charged after an attack left a man in a 'life-threatening condition'.

item.title: Shielding from Covid: 'I couldn't face going back to work'
item.description: Concerns about contracting Covid, even after being fully vaccinated, sees one woman quit her job.

item.title: Richards & Jarvis help GB win Olympic gold
item.description: Great Britain's men secure another gold in the Olympic pool with a dominant victory in the 4x200m freestyle relay in Tokyo.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Almost a quarter absent from school at end of term
item.description: Just over 90,000 pupils in Wales were absent from school in the last full week of term, figures show.

item.title: Eagle eyes spot kestrel chicks in jet plane exhaust
item.description: The young birds "lucky to be alive" after found hiding in exhaust of an Airbus plane during repairs.

item.title: Pub beer garden crash man 'happy to be alive'
item.description: Darren George, 30, remains in hospital after a car crashed into a pub beer garden.

item.title: Barras helps GB win Olympic rowing silver
item.description: Britain's rowers win their first Olympic medal in the men's quadruple sculls as Harry Leask, Angus Groom, Tom Barras and Jack Beaumont claim silver at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Shielding will not be used again, top doctor says
item.description: The Welsh government says it will not ask 130,000 vulnerable people to isolate at home in future.

item.title: David Jones death: Man jailed for nine years for manslaughter
item.description: David John Jones died in hospital after he was assaulted in Holyhead, in November.

item.title: Lumberjack out of sight when tree crushed him to death
item.description: Ben Thomas died at work when a tree fell on him as he cleared wood from a forest.

item.title: World War Two Arctic Convoys veteran given Royal Navy funeral
item.description: Alan Higgins honoured after surviving being torpedoed, the D-Day landings and World War Two.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's Lauren Price reaches middleweight quarter-finals
item.description: Team GB's Lauren Price eases through the middleweight round of 16 at the Tokyo Olympics, beating Mongolian Munkhbat Myagmarjargal.

item.title: Waterspout appears off west Wales coast
item.description: Waterspouts occur when a tornado forms over oceans, rivers or lakes.

item.title: Pontyclun beer garden crash survivor 'happy to be alive'
item.description: Darren George said he is just "happy to be alive" despite breaking his leg and ankle in the crash.

item.title: Black representation: ‘I never saw a teacher who looked like me’
item.description: Natalie Jones says teaching did not seem like a possible career choice for her.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Williams' family celebrate silver medal success
item.description: Lauren Williams' sister proud of Tokyo 2020 taekwondo runner-up as family cheer on Welsh star.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Williams takes taekwondo silver for Great Britain
item.description: Great Britain's Lauren Williams takes silver in the women's -67kg taekwondo after losing the final to Croatia's Matea Jelic at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Welsh swimming duo end 109-year wait for Games gold
item.description: You wait 109 years for a Welsh Olympic swimming gold medal and then two come along at once in Tokyo.

item.title: Cardiff City: Manager Mick McCarthy facing injury and Covid concerns
item.description: Cardiff City are facing several injury and Covid concerns before their opening game of the Championship season.

item.title: Lauren Price's Olympic boxing debut 'couldn't have gone any better'
item.description: World champion middleweight Lauren Price says her Olympic boxing debut could not have gone any better after securing her place in the quarter-final.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Geraint Thomas and Tao Geoghegan Hart finish outside top 10 in time trial
item.description: Britain's Geraint Thomas and Tao Geoghegan Hart finish outside the top 10 as Slovenia's Primoz Roglic wins time trial gold at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Timmy Abraham: Fulham forward joins Newport County on loan
item.description: Fulham forward Timmy Abraham says he is raring to go after joining Newport County on loan.

item.title: Medalau aur cyntaf i Gymry yn Tokyo
item.description: Medal aur i Matthew Richards a Calum Jarvis yn y pwll nofio i Team GB, a medal arian hefyd i'r rhwyfwr Tom Barras.

item.title: Statws Treftadaeth Byd wedi cael effaith bositif
item.description: Cyn penderfyniad UNESCO am ardaloedd llechi Gwynedd, gwahaniaeth barn am yr effaith bosib.

item.title: Cyhuddo merch 16 oed o geisio llofruddio dyn yng Nghaerdydd
item.description: Mae dau ddyn eisoes wedi bod ger bron llys wedi i ddyn gael anafiadau sy'n bygwth ei fywyd.

item.title: Beth sy'n digwydd yn Eisteddfod 2021?
item.description: Sut allwch chi ddilyn y Brifwyl eleni?

item.title: Tri newid i'r Llewod ar gyfer yr ail gêm brawf
item.description: Conor Murray, Chris Harris a Mako Vunipola yn dechrau, gyda'r Cymro, Taulupe Faletau ar y fainc.
